title: Extends and applies understanding of relationship between addition and subtraction
Sorts / classifies / groups different items and acquires and uses appropriate vocabulary [using non measurable attributes like shape, color, texture]
Understands part to whole concept of fractions, language of fractions and representations [with help of models, dot papers, concrete representations]
Knows number properties like prime, composite, twin prime and co prime and what the terms mean.
Creates patterns, extends and interpolates given patterns [both number and shapes]
Solves real life problems orally pertaining to division.
Expands understanding of the concept of taking away [subtraction] and acquires the skill of finding the difference between three digit numbers and upto three digit numbers
Understands any 4 digit number and can apply it in real life context.
Arrives at and explains the formulae for calculating area of square, rectangle and triangle.
Applies understanding of patterns in numbers - patterns of addends [pair of numbers whose sum is 10]
Understands place value in three digit numbers in terms of units, tens and hundreds.
Classifies shapes using nomenclature such as 2-D and 3-D shapes
Understands and recognises perspective drawings of simple objects
Learns to use calibrated instruments to measure length and distances accurate to mm
Arrives at place value beyond 10,000 using known strategies and knows nomenclature in the Indian system upto a crore.
Expresses measured quantity [length, weight, volume] using units thus quantifying the number and chooses smaller and larger units of measurement depending on the purpose
Expands understanding and uses the skill of division [up to 3 digit dividends by divisors not greater than 15] to solve problems
Understands number upto 100 and applies in real life context.
Finds the sum of 2 two digit numbers [represented both in horizontal and vertical forms] with and without carry over and is familiar with vocabulary of addition [sum upto 100]
Appreciates the need for a standard tool to measure length and distance
Compares and orders objects using measurable attributes and acquires related vocabulary
Estimates, measures and compares area using non standard units. [using activities like tiling]
Creates and analyzes patterns of square numbers using both numbers and shapes [addition of odd numbers or difference between consecutive squares]
Investigates and identifies symmetry in shapes
Solves simple and multi step daily life problems that involve more than one operation
Understands the relationship between division and multiplication and identifies a division fact given the multiplication fact and vice versa. Applies to solve word problems.
Compares and orders fractions [uses visual models and representations.]
Adds, Subtracts, multiplies and divides fractions
Finds the product of two digit numbers by one digit number with and without carry over using multiple methods
Measures and compares length of objects and height using non standard units like hand span and foot length; expresses measure as x hand spans or y foot length
Understands the need for standard weights to measure weight and uses them to determine weight using pan balance
Estimates, measures and compares length of objects and height using non standard units like hand span and foot length; expresses measure as x hand spans or y foot length
Collects, organizes and interprets data to understand the world around
Understands properties of addition and subtraction like commutative property, associative property, sum and difference with zero. Applies properties to add and subtract.
Understands the concept and skill of division. [2, 3 digit dividend by single digit divisor,
Expresses measured quantity [length, weight, volume] using units thus quantifying the number and chooses smaller and larger units of measurement depending on the purpose
Applies knowledge of fractions and decimals to calculate fractional measures and rates.
Compares and interprets two different sets of data and draws conclusion
Applies the knowledge of relationship between multiplication and division and solves word problems that involve one or both operations.
Using concrete objects, finds the difference between two numbers [up to 20]
Understands any 3 digit number and can apply it in real life context.
Understands number upto 20 and applies in real life context.
Understands time in different units [days, weeks, months and year], and uses calendar in various context for reference and prediction.
Recognises different kinds of lines and surfaces based on their orientation and properties

Understands properties of multiplication like commutative, [axb = bxa] associative, ax[bxc] = [axb]xc multiplicative identity [multiplying by one], distributive and multiplication of zero; Uses knowledge of properties during problem solving
Identifies, measures and constructs angles. [ acute angle, obtuse angle and right angle]
Extends, completes and creates complex patterns [using shapes and numbers, knowledge of symmetry, Drawing tiling patterns, tessellations etc]
Understands and uses [analog and digial] clock in various context for reference and prediction
Understands and differentiates curved and straight lines, properties of a line and constructs line segments
Understands different aspects of graphs like scale, X and Y axis and uses this to interpret and represent data in the form of graphs
Given a multiplication fact, identifies factors and multiples of numbers correctly.
Sorts and names triangles based on sides and angles
Extends, completes and creates complex patterns [using shapes and numbers, knowledge of symmetry, Drawing tiling patterns, tessellations etc]
Applies knowledge of fractions, decimals, measures, units and conversions to solve problems in real life context.
Derives and comprehends the meaning of average and finds average of a set of data
Finds the difference of 2 two digit numbers [represented both in horizontal and vertical forms] with and without regrouping and is familiar with vocabulary of subtraction
Understands fractions as equal share.
Uses a pan balance to compare weight of different objects and measures weight using non standard units
Uses non standard measures to find volume of liquids and capacity of containers and expresses them as 'x' cups or 'y' mugs
Uses collections, grids and area diagrams understands multiplicative thinking and uses fractions as an operator.
Uses understanding of relationship between addition and subtraction and properties to solve different kinds of word problems that involve one or more operations
Understands numbers up to 10 and applies them in real life.
Applies knowledge of association between number and quantity and compares numbers upto 20
Describes and classifies objects based on some geometrical ideas like number of sides, angles etc

Understands properties of multiplication like commutative, [axb = bxa] associative, ax[bxc] = [axb]xc multiplicative identity [multiplying by one], distributive and multiplication of zero; Uses knowledge of properties during problem solving
Finds the product of two numbers with and without carry over using multiple methods
Uses standard measures and pan balance and arrives at conversion between different units. [kg to g, decomposes larger weights]
Estimates, measures and compares perimeter of closed figures and solves real life problems.
Interprets pictures on real life context to answer simple questions
Creates and analyzes patterns of triangular numbers using both numbers and shapes
Using concrete objects, counts and creates addition facts upto 10; extraploates knowledge of addition to add numbers whose sum is less than 20
Understands the concept of division through contextual problems.
Counts and recognises, writes numerals for numbers upto 100
Recognises patterns in numbers and number operations - patterns of addends, interrelationship between addition and subtraction.
Develops a deeper understanding and extends knowledge of properties addition and subtraction to solve problems
Knows terms related to a circle and semi-circle such as radius, circumference and constructs a circle
Uses collections, grids and area diagrams understands multiplicative thinking and uses fractions as an operator.
Compares [and orders] decimals up to 2 decimal places. Recognises that for this, the whole has to be the same.
Understands and uses metric tables for measurement
Extends understanding of relationship between addition and subtraction
Creates patterns, extends and interpolates given patterns [both number and shapes]
Understands place value of 4 digit numbers and works with numbers upto 10,000
Using materials in the environment, creates patterns and recognizes them in the surroundings
Understands equivalence in fractions and generates equivalent sets
Compares and orders fractions [uses visual models, representations or number line.]
Understands the idea of an angle and measures an angle using non-standardised tools such as cardboard triangle, rhombus etc.
Expands understanding of concept of addition and acquires the skill of adding three digit numbers with upto three digit numbers [sum within 1,000]
Investigates shapes / patterns for half and quarter rotation symmetry
Articulates strategies used in problem solving verbally.
Understands that both fractions and ratio indicate quantitative relationship and interprets ratio using part:whole relationship.
Extends knowledge of operations and place value to add, subtract, multiply and divide decimals.
Acquires spatial sense and related vocabulary and uses them to describe objects in the environment
Applies knowledge of fractions to calculate fractional measures and rates
Knows and applies divisibility rules to solve problems
Articulates strategies used in problem solving verbally.
Understands concept of unit and composite fractions.
Solves word problems that involve fractions, decimals or decimal solutions in the context of daily life.
Recognises 0 as a number that signifies the absence of quantities or objects.Recognises 0 as a starting point (for eg. Length)
Understands that addition and subtraction are related.
Understands properties of addition and subtraction like commutative property, associative property, sum and difference with zero. Applies properties to add and subtract.
Compares the difference between using standard and non standard measures to find volume of liquids and capacity of containers
Understands place value in two digit numbers in terms of units and tens
Collects, organizes and interprets data for a defined objective
Understands properties of addition and subtraction like commutative property, associative property, sum and difference with zero. Applies properties to add and subtract.
Solves word problems that involve real life context like money, time, measures using knowledge of number operations [whole numbers, fractions and decimals]
Solves real life problems orally pertaining to addition and subtraction upto 10.
Solves real life problems orally pertaining to multiplication upto 20. Understands the aspect of repeated addition in multiplication
Solves word problems that involve measures and money that require simple conversions applying knowledge of number operations
Expands understanding and uses the concept and skill of multiplication [3 digits by 2 digit numbers and beyond]
Understands decimal fractions, place value and decimal notations of decimal fractions
